radiographic_examinations.findings: Visualized lung fields demonstrate a 5 mm ground-glass nodule in the right middle lobe. There is no evidence of pleural or pericardial effusion. Wall thickening and hyperemia of the cecum. A heterogeneous loculated fluid collection adjacent to the cecum measuring approximately 6.7 x 3.4 cm, previously 6.6 x 3.6 cm when remeasured. Normal findings in liver, pancreas, spleen, kidneys, urinary bladder, and reproductive organs.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: The heterogeneous loculated fluid collection adjacent to the cecum is grossly unchanged in size and appearance.
